section.title: Prerequisites
section.para:
At least two machines are needed to install Ulteo Open Virtual Desktop:
a LAMP (Linux Apache MySQL PHP) server for the Session Manager (here we are using sm.ulteo.com for that server, but you need to set your own domain name)
another server for the Application Server. (here we are using cm.ulteo.com for that server, but you need to set it according to your own domain name)

section.title: Configuration
section.para: The first step is to go to and autenticate yourself with the login and password you provided during the installation.
For the first time you login, the system detect that is not well configured so you are redirected to a basic setup page which will save a default configuration.

simplesect.title: Applications server settings
simplesect.para: Before begin to install an Application server, we just have to setup the authorized server list in order to your server won't be refused.
So, go to Configuration then Server settings.
In our example, the Application server named is aps.ulteo.com:

section.para: For other specific configuration, please refer to the Administration Console documentation.
The session manager has no application server plugged yet. You now have to install one or more application servers.

section.title: Register the server and perform a "Publication"
section.para:
An Application server has been installed and is now ready. First, we have to register it, and switch it from "maintenance" to "production" mode.
Your server should appear in the Unregistered server page.
Session Manager - server page
If your server does not appear in the list, you might have a DNS configuration issue, please report to the FAQ to solve this issue.
If you want to use this server on your network, you have to click on register to accept the server in your environment and switch it to maintenance mode.
Now, click on Switch to production to switch it to Production mode.

simplesect.title: Publication
simplesect.para: A publication is an association between a users group and an applications group. It's an authorization for a users group to launch the applications include in the group.
By default, there is no users or applications group installed so you have to create it to launch sessions (it's not possible to launch session without application in the default configuration).
To simplify the process, you can use the Publication wizard by going on Applications page.
Go to the Publications page, select and follow the wizard steps.
